body:
Please can you post the full error trace?

I don't know what's causing that, but for what it's worth, it works with a MINGW64 shell (from Git Bash) and Python 2.7.9:

```
$ pip install pillow
Collecting pillow
  Using cached Pillow-3.1.0-cp27-none-win_amd64.whl
Installing collected packages: pillow
Successfully installed pillow-3.1.0
```

Working in a clean virtualenv, python 3.4.3, cygwin64, pip 8.0.2

`$ pip install Pillow &> Pillow-Failure.txt`


Try 

```
MAX_CONCURRENCY=1 pip install pillow
```

I'm wondering if the multithreaded compile is killing it, and the existing filters in `mp_compile:install()` aren't catching it because it's cygwin and not winpython.
That appears to have done the trick. Thanks for your help. So it sounds like this is something that can be added to the filters you mentioned?
What's the value of `sys.platform` on cygwin?
Can you check that the PR #1700 works?

I haven't tried to build local packages into a python virtualenv before. But this is what I did and it worked.

Cloned and checked out the branch with the appropriate commit into a clean virtualenv
Ran: `pip install pillow --global-option="build_ext"`
Got the `Successfully installed pillow-3.1.0` message

From what I've read the `--global-option="build_ext"` should have told pip to build the thing in the cwd. And it should not have built successfully otherwise.

issue.title: Error upon pip installation in cygwin terminal run on Windows

labels.name: Packaging
labels.description: Any mention of setup.py; some overlap with Install label

issue.body:
I ran the command pip install Pillow
I expected the Pillow Package to install but instead got the following error

`Command "/usr/bin/python3 -u -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/tmp/pip-build-rgaobc15/Pillow/setup.py';f=getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('\r\n', '\n');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, 'exec'))" install --record /tmp/pip-0t2ptbmp-record/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-build-rgaobc15/Pillow/`

I am using pip version  9.0.1 python version 3.6.3 and I'm trying to install PIllow version 4.3.0
